description.en:
The seminar is primarily focused on supporting students' succesful completion of their master's thesis or final comprehensive exam. Additionally, it also deals with mapping and analyzing students' personal learning needs and supporting their development. If necessary, guest lecturers and study visits will be included in the course to help students with academic writing, public speaking and research methods. 

 

The seminar is articulated across three semesters (2nd, 3rd, and 4th), followed by writing and defence of MA thesis. The 2nd semester part is common to all students, while the sessions of the 3rd and 4th parts are differentiated according to their choice to finalize their studies with a master's thesis or with the final comprehensive exam.

objectives.en:
The aim of the development seminar is to support the students - both as a group and individually - in the process of thesis writing and finalization of the master's thesis or in the preparation of the final comprehensive exam. Within the framework of the seminar, students expand their understanding of academic writing and research methods and design as well as public speaking and presentations, project management. In addition, the aim is to offer students a supportive learning environment. 

 

Development seminar is a part of the Master thesis module.

learning_outcomes.en:
By the end of the course, participating student: 

- has improved their ability to plan their work 

- is able to formulate a relevant, well-justified and original research question and choose an appropriate research design to answer that question 

- is able to link theoretical approaches to research methods and empirical analysis 

- is able to present analytical, structured and well-substantiated arguments 

- is familiar with principles of academic writing and code of conduct for academic research 

- is able to critically connect the knowledge acquired across the courses offered by the curriculum 

- is able to originally combine such knowledge in creative ways 

- can solve complex problems related to the theoretical and practical aspects addressed during the study years.

independent_work.et:
Iga semestri alguses mõtestame ja eesmärgistame mis meid ootab ja mida me tahame saavutada. See on osa isiklikust arenguplaanist. Iga semestri lõpus loeme ja analüüsime mida me oleme saavutanud ja millised õppetunnid võtame kaasa järgmisesse semestrisse. See teeb juba 2 kirjaliku kodutööd (žanr: essee) semestris. Lisaks semestrite jooksul on üks kohustuslik läbiv ülesanne, kompaktne 200-500 sõna - õppesessioonide reflektsioon. See aitab leida seoseid ning enne järgmist sessiooni meelde tuletada mis toimus eelmisel, mis mõtted tekkisid jne.
Kuna igal semestril on oma fookus, kõik ülejäänud kodutööd sõltuvad sellest. Kolmanda semestri fookuses on:
- Õppetöö ja isikliku arengu toetamine
- Magistritöö laiendatud kava esitamine
- Magistritöö kirjutamise planeerimine ja toetamine
- Magistritöö osaoskuste arendmine ja planeerimine
- Kursuse projekti elluviimine
- Võrgustiku arendamine ja EL karjäärivõimalustega tutvumine

Arenguseminari 3.osa läbimiseks on vajalik kõikide iseseisvate tööde edukas sooritamine, täpsemad juhised avalikustatakse Moodles. Arenguseminari sessioonides vähema ja ebaaktiivse osalemise puhul tuleb arvestuse saamiseks kirjutada lisakodutöö.

Tagasisidet antakse järgneval moel:
* Individuaalne tagasiside kohtumistel või kirjalikult;
* Kaastudengite tagasiside esitluste ja ülesannete täitmise järel;
* Kursuse juhendajalt.

grade_preconditions.et:
Iga semester tudengeid hinnatakse vatavalt nende panusele seminarides ja mentorluskohtumise ning kodutööde põhjal lähtudes järgmistest kriteeriumitest:
* Kodutööd ja esseed vastavad seatud eesmärkidele.
* Esitlused annavad aru kodutöödes asetleidnud protsessidest ja saavutustest.

grade_evaluation.et: Aine läbimiseks on vajalik kõikide kodutööde edukas sooritamine ja vähemalt 50% loengutes osalemine.
